Exogenous estrogen and testosterone therapies have a therapeutic potential to mitigate the damaging inflammatory response to SARS-CoV-2 without hampering the immune system’s response to the virus as corticosteroids do.
33 Recently, investigators have suggested the use of immune-modulating drugs to block inflammatory markers’ receptors to mitigate the amplified and tissue-damaging immune response of SARS-CoV-2 (eg, anarka [an IL-1 receptor blocker] and tocilizumab and sarilumab [IL-6 receptor antagonists]).
